title: Getting Started with gbifrules
text: gbifrules package provides R interface GBIF (Global Biodiversity Information Facility) rule-based annotation store. package allows : Create manage annotation projects Define rules flag suspicious occurrence records Clean GBIF downloads using annotation rules Collaborate users annotation projects

title: Getting Started with gbifrules
text: using package, need set GBIF credentials. easiest way add .Renviron file: Add lines file opens: Save file restart R changes take effect.

title: Getting Started with gbifrules
code: library(gbifrules)  # Create a new project my_project <- make_project(   name = "Invasive Species Monitoring",   description = "Flagging potentially invasive species occurrences" )

title: Getting Started with gbifrules
text: Let’s create rule flag Ambystoma mexicanum (Mexican axolotl) records outside native range: rule flag . mexicanum records fall outside specified polygon.
code: # Define the native range (rough polygon around Mexico) native_range <- "POLYGON((-106 19, -106 21, -98 21, -98 19, -106 19))"  # Create the rule rule <- make_rule(   projectId = my_project$id,   taxonKey = 431950,  # Ambystoma mexicanum   notGeometry = native_range,   annotation = "INVASIVE",   annotationComment = "Ambystoma mexicanum outside native range in Mexico" )

title: Getting Started with gbifrules
text: can create complex rules additional filters:
code: # Flag only preserved specimens from recent years rule <- make_rule(   projectId = my_project$id,   taxonKey = 431950,   notGeometry = native_range,   basisOfRecord = list("PRESERVED_SPECIMEN"),   yearRange = list(min = 2010),   annotation = "INVASIVE",   annotationComment = "Recent preserved specimens outside native range" )

title: Getting Started with gbifrules
text: rules set , can use clean GBIF downloads:
code: # Download some data using rgbif library(rgbif)  d <- occ_download_get("0051416-241126133413365") %>%   occ_download_import()  # Clean the data using your project's rules cleaned_data <- clean_download(d, project_id = my_project$id)  # Or filter by multiple projects cleaned_data <- clean_download(d, project_id = c(1, 2, 3))

title: Getting Started with gbifrules
text: can view, support, contest existing rules:
code: # Get a specific rule rule_info <- get_rule(rule$id)  # Support a rule support_rule(rule$id)  # Contest a rule with a comment contest_rule(   ruleId = rule$id,   comment = "This range definition seems too restrictive" )

title: Getting Started with gbifrules
text: Explore function reference detailed documentation Check annotation types available GBIF Collaborate others adding project members using add_project_member()

title: Getting Started with gbifrules
text: encounter issues questions: Check GitHub repository Review function documentation: ?make_rule, ?clean_download, etc.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Waller J (2026). gbifrules: R interface GBIF rule-based annotations store. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gbifrules: R interface to GBIF rule-based annotations store},   author = {John Waller},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

what: gbifrules - R Interface to GBIF Rule-Based Annotations
title: gbifrules - R Interface to GBIF Rule-Based Annotations
text: gbifrules R package filtering GBIF occurrence data using spatial annotation rules created GBIF community. package wraps GBIF annotation API order create apply user-curated rules identify suspicious problematic occurrence records.

title: gbifrules - R Interface to GBIF Rule-Based Annotations
code: # CRAN version  install.packages("gbifrules") # Install development version pak::pak("gbif/occurrence-annotation/r-package/gbifrules")

title: gbifrules - R Interface to GBIF Rule-Based Annotations
code: library(gbifrules) library(rgbif) # Ambystoma mexicanum # make a fresh download using rgbif # occ_download(pred("taxonKey" ,"2431950"))  # Download occurrence data from GBIF d <- occ_download_get('0004693-260120142942310') %>%   occ_download_import()  # Clean the download using all available annotation rules clean_download(d)  # Filter your data using only rules from a specific project: clean_download(d, project_id = 1)  # Filter using rules from multiple projects: clean_download(d, project_id = c(1, 2, 3))

title: gbifrules - R Interface to GBIF Rule-Based Annotations
text: Fetches rules GBIF API taxon keys data Applies spatial filters using polygon geometries annotation rules Evaluates additional criteria like basisOfRecord datasetKey specified Returns cleaned data suspicious records removed flagged

title: gbifrules - R Interface to GBIF Rule-Based Annotations
text: can create manage annotation rules programmatically using gbifrules package. Although time easier use GBIF Annotation UI rule creation management.

title: gbifrules - R Interface to GBIF Rule-Based Annotations
text: write operations require GBIF credentials. Set environment variables:
code: usethis::edit_r_environ() # Then add these lines: # GBIF_USER=your_gbif_username # GBIF_PWD=your_gbif_password # Save the file and restart R

title: gbifrules - R Interface to GBIF Rule-Based Annotations
code: # Create a rule flagging occurrences as suspicious in a specific area make_rule(   taxonKey = 431950,  # Ambystoma mexicanum (axolotl)   geometry = "POLYGON((5 50, 10 50, 10 55, 5 55, 5 50))",   annotation = "SUSPICIOUS" )

what: Creating a Rule with Additional Filters
title: gbifrules - R Interface to GBIF Rule-Based Annotations
code: # Flag only machine observations as suspicious make_rule(   taxonKey = 431950,   geometry = "POLYGON((5 50, 10 50, 10 55, 5 55, 5 50))",   annotation = "SUSPICIOUS",   basisOfRecord = c("MACHINE_OBSERVATION"),   yearRange = "2000,2023" )

title: gbifrules - R Interface to GBIF Rule-Based Annotations
code: # 1. Create a project to organize related rules project <- make_project(   name = "European Oak Distribution",   description = "Cleaning oak occurrence data in Europe" )  project_id <- project$id  # 2. Add rules to the project make_rule(   taxonKey = 431950,   geometry = "POLYGON((5 50, 10 50, 10 55, 5 55, 5 50))",   annotation = "SUSPICIOUS",   projectId = project_id )

title: gbifrules - R Interface to GBIF Rule-Based Annotations
code: # Get all rules get_rule(limit=10)  # Get rules for a specific project get_rule(projectId = 1)  # Get a specific rule by ID get_rule(id = 1)  # upvote or downvote a rule support_rule(id = 1) contest_rule(id = 1)

title: gbifrules - R Interface to GBIF Rule-Based Annotations
text: GBIF Annotation API GBIF Annotation UI rgbif package

what: Clean a GBIF download of suspicious records using complex rules — clean_download
title: Clean a GBIF download of suspicious records using complex rules — clean_download
text: Removes records marked suspicious annotation users using complex rules. filters based SUSPICIOUS annotations, ignoring annotation types. project_id provided, rules belonging project(s) used.

title: Clean a GBIF download of suspicious records using complex rules — clean_download
code: clean_download(   d,   rm_suspicious = TRUE,   handle_conflicts = "favor_suspicious",   project_id = NULL )

title: Clean a GBIF download of suspicious records using complex rules — clean_download
text: d GBIF download DWCA format rm_suspicious removes records suspicious annotations handle_conflicts handle conflicting annotations project_id optional project ID(s) filter rules specific project(s). Can single ID vector IDs.

title: Clean a GBIF download of suspicious records using complex rules — clean_download

what: Create a new annotation rule — make_rule
title: Create a new annotation rule — make_rule
Create a new annotation rule — make_rule
code: make_rule(   taxonKey = NULL,   geometry = NULL,   annotation = NULL,   basisOfRecord = NULL,   basisOfRecordNegated = NULL,   yearRange = NULL,   rulesetId = NULL,   projectId = NULL,   supportedBy = NULL,   contestedBy = NULL,   created = NULL,   createdBy = NULL,   deleted = NULL,   deletedBy = NULL,   ... )

title: Create a new annotation rule — make_rule
text: taxonKey (integer) GBIF taxonKey rule applies (required). geometry (character) WKT text string defining geographic boundary rule (required). annotation (character) Annotation type controlled vocabulary (e.g., "SUSPICIOUS", "INTRODUCED", "NATIVE") (required). basisOfRecord (character vector) Optional vector basis record values rule applies (e.g., c("MACHINE_OBSERVATION", "HUMAN_OBSERVATION")). basisOfRecordNegated (logical) Optional flag negate basisOfRecord filter. yearRange (character) Optional year range format "start,end" (e.g., "2000,2023") temporal filtering. rulesetId (character integer) Optional ID ruleset rule belongs . projectId (character integer) Optional ID project rule belongs . supportedBy (character vector) Optional vector user IDs support rule. contestedBy (character vector) Optional vector user IDs contest rule. created (character) Optional creation timestamp (ISO format). createdBy (character) Optional user ID rule creator. provided, automatically set GBIF_USER environment variable. deleted (character) Optional deletion timestamp (ISO format). deletedBy (character) Optional user ID deleted rule. ... Additional named parameters include rule payload.

title: Create a new annotation rule — make_rule
text: list containing API response information created rule.

title: Create a new annotation rule — make_rule
text: Creates new annotation rule via GBIF annotation service API. rule defines geographic area (via WKT geometry) taxonomic scope (via taxonKey) occurrences flagged specified annotation type. annotation parameter must controlled vocabulary (e.g., "SUSPICIOUS", "INTRODUCED", "NATIVE"). basisOfRecord parameter accepts character vector serialized JSON array API request.

title: Create a new annotation rule — make_rule
code: if (FALSE) { # Simple rule with required parameters make_rule(   taxonKey = 1,   geometry = "POLYGON ((30 10, 40 40, 20 40, 10 20, 30 10))",    annotation = "NATIVE" )  # Complex rule with basis of record filter make_rule(   taxonKey = 12345,   geometry = "POLYGON ((0 0, 10 0, 10 10, 0 10, 0 0))",   annotation = "SUSPICIOUS",   basisOfRecord = c("MACHINE_OBSERVATION", "HUMAN_OBSERVATION"),   createdBy = "user@example.com" ) }

title: Make Ruleset — make_ruleset
code: make_ruleset(projectId = NULL, name = NULL, description = NULL)

title: Make Ruleset — make_ruleset
text: projectId id project ruleset belong . name name project. description describe project.

Update a project — update_project
code: update_project(   id = NULL,   name = NULL,   description = NULL,   members = NULL,   deleted = NULL,   createdBy = NULL,   keep_members = TRUE )

title: Update a project — update_project
text: id project id. name new name project. description new description project. members new members. `keep_members=TRUE`, new added old members. deleted logical project deleted restored. createdBy new creator project. keep_members keep old members. Default TRUE.

title: Update a project — update_project
text: Update project. fields left `NULL`, updated.  `keep_memebers=TRUE`, new members added list old members.

title: Update a ruleset — update_ruleset
code: update_ruleset(   id = NULL,   projectId = NULL,   name = NULL,   description = NULL,   members = NULL,   deleted = NULL,   createdBy = NULL,   keep_members = TRUE )

title: Update a ruleset — update_ruleset
text: id ruleset. projectId id project ruleset belongs. name new name ruleset. description new description ruleset. members new members ruleset. `keep_members=TRUE`, new added old members. deleted logical ruleset deleted restored. createdBy new creator ruleset. keep_members keep old members. Default TRUE.
